H0.text: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s. FreeBSD

H1.text: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s. NetBSD

H2.text: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s. OpenBSD

H3.text: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s. Linux

A4.text: Linux is an open source Unix-compatible operating system that was first released on September 17, 1991, by Linus Torvalds.

A5.text: Linux distributions became popular in the 1990s and effectively made Unix technologies accessible to home users on personal computers whereas previously it had been confined to sophisticated workstations.
